channel.title: Forgot
channel.description: How to make cmd promts disappear after startup . .

item.title: Forgot
item.dc:creator: @Mercifies Mercifies
item.description:

@off topic

Haha Frell nice avatar

Read full topic

item.title: Forgot
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

Im assuming that you’re referring to the batch window that you’re using to start the program. If you start the program without using a batch file, it would be pretty annoying to have to go into your processes and terminate it every time you need to restart it. The only other way to get it to start without a black box is to create your own GUI and running it from there. Or start it from within an IDE.

Read full topic

item.title: Forgot
item.dc:creator: @Mercifies Mercifies
item.description:
@Mercifies wrote:

Okay then the code would be

@echo off title RuneScape Start javaw -Xmx500m -cp .;Theme.jar EGUI exit

You would replace the Start blah blah blah part with what ever you have but I’m pretty sure you have to keep the command prompt open while running the client. When I close out of my run.bat, the client automatically closes too. But yours may be different…

Read full topic

item.title: Forgot
item.dc:creator: @Dell Dell
item.description:
@Dell wrote:

[quote=“cafoozle, post:13, topic:337886”][quote author=deathschaos9 link=topic=434285.msg3188961#msg3188961 date=1272060152]
I’m mad you said pause has nothing to do with it…
[/quote]

It really doesnt. Just get rid of the pause and it will close automaticly. He just said. I want it to close after startup. He didn’t state how he wanted it to close. He just said close. Delete the pause and it’ll close by itself.

None will work dummy… ‘Pause’ keeps them all open.

ya it will say hit any key to continue… just hit spacebar and it will still run. He just said he wanted it to close. So…

It will still work without the pause. Just delete it. Its not the end of the world.

no its doesnt. .
dude just stop.

death you have any idea?

well it works for non-cheat clients. So whatever.[/quote]

DELETING THE PAUSE WONT MAKE IT CLOSE AFTER START UP, AND I SPECIFICALLY SAID

Dell:

How to make cmd promts disappear after startup . .

WHICH MEANS WHEN YOUSTART UP THE PROMPT IT WILL CLOSE,
YOU TRIED, BUT JUST STOP . .

Read full topic

item.title: Forgot
item.dc:creator: @cafoozle cafoozle
item.description:
@cafoozle wrote:

[quote=“Dell, post:5, topic:337886”]im trying to make my cheat client config with chat server, and it worked but know i have 3 cmd prompts which is totally ugly.

and the -xmx500m has nothing to do with closing the cmd prompt …

explain how you would close this command prompt . .

@ECHO OF cd DellCCXx start client[/quote]

I will give you a few suggestions try these

@ECHO OF cd DellCCXx start client pause

@ECHO OF cd DellCCXx start client start javaw pause

@ECHO OF cd DellCCXx start client start javaw -Xmx500m -cp .;Theme.jar pause

@ECHO OF cd DellCCXx start client start javaw -Xmx500m -cp .;Theme.jar EGUI pause

@ECHO OF cd DellCCXx start client start javaw -Xmx500m -cp .;Theme.jar gui pause

EDIT:

Dude just you having [code]pause[/code] on that prompt you already have it wrong . ..

The pause has nothing to do with it.

Read full topic

item.title: Forgot
item.dc:creator: @Dell Dell
item.description:
@Dell wrote:

[quote=“cafoozle, post:4, topic:337886”][quote author=Dell link=topic=434285.msg3188936#msg3188936 date=1272059026]

@echo off title RuneScape Start javaw -Xmx500m -cp .;Theme.jar EGUI pause

no.
[/quote]

It should work. What base are you using?

And you have to change the -Xmx500m the the one it is in your current run.bat

EDIT:

If you want it for when you start your server put this

@echo off title RuneScape start javaw -Xmx512m -cp .;./jython.jar;./MySql/mysql-connector-java-3.0.08-ga-bin.jar server pause[/quote]

Dude just you having pause on that prompt you already have it wrong . …

Read full topic

item.title: Forgot
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

Adding a pause means after it starts the Java App the cmd prompt will read

Press any key to continue…
